meanings.definition: the state of being divided into factions
meanings.sent1: The factionalism within the student council led to disagreements and arguments.
meanings.sent2: Political factionalism can sometimes hinder progress and unity.
meanings.sent3: The factionalism among the ants over the best route to the picnic was quite comical.
meanings.sent4: The factionalism in the workplace was like a tangled web of conflicting interests.
meanings.sent5: The factionalism in the family made holiday gatherings quite tense.

meanings.definition: the practice of forming or supporting factions
meanings.sent1: His factionalism in organizing the event helped bring together like-minded individuals.
meanings.sent2: The factionalism in the political party was evident during the election campaign.
meanings.sent3: Her factionalism in choosing the movie for movie night caused some playful arguments.
meanings.sent4: The factionalism in the gaming community resembled a battle for dominance.
meanings.sent5: His factionalism in the debate club made him a natural leader.

meanings.definition: the existence of conflicting groups within a larger group
meanings.sent1: The factionalism within the team affected their overall performance.
meanings.sent2: Religious factionalism has been a source of tension throughout history.
meanings.sent3: The factionalism among the vegetables in the fridge was quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: The factionalism in the animal kingdom is a constant struggle for resources.
meanings.sent5: The factionalism in the classroom made group projects challenging.
